term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - radiant intensity, I
term.title: radiant intensity

item.text: Radiant power, P, at all wavelengths per solid angle, Ω. The radiant poweremitted in a given direction by a source or an element of the source in a small cone containing the given direction divided by the solid angle of the cone. SI unit is W sr-1.

notes.item: Mathematical definition: I = dP/dΩ. If the radiant power is constant over the solid angle considered, I = P/Ω.
Equivalent to I = ∫(λ) Iλ.dλ, where Iλ is the spectral radiant intensity at wavelength λ.
It is not recommended to abbreviate this term to just intensity because it is confusing.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 410 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
